history.text: Hi, what movie did you read about?
Hello there, it's a film called The Shape Of Water
What actors are starring in it?
Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Richard Jenkins, Octavia Spencer, Michael Stuhlbarg are the main cast
It's a fantasy drama directed by Guillermo Del Toro
It's also set in Baltimore in 1962, so it is a period piece
Are you there?
Yes sorry!
What's the rating?
Do you mean critically ?
I mean PG, PG-13, etc.
It does not say.
It's about a mute custodian working at a high security government laboratory who falls in love with a captured humanoid amphibian creature
And Sally Hawkins plays Elisa, who is the mute cleaner, so she communicates through sign language
What do the critics say?
Or the general critic consensus?
They're raving, 92 % on Rotten Tomatoes with an average rating of 8.4/10, 87 on Metacritic, an A CinemaScore
Cool! Did it win any awards?
Maybe you can check online but are you interested in films with creatures? It also takes place at the height of the Cold War which is a cool background
Is the Cold War involved in the plot or more of just the setting?
It is involved in the plot as there is a Soviet spy in the storyline, working as a scientist
How much did the movie make?
how much money I mean

I am not sure about that but did you know that Michael Shannon plays a colonel in charge of the project to study the "asset", which is this mysterious creature that was captured from a South American river
I'm not sure who Michael Shannon is. What other movies is he in?
Maybe you can check online but did you know that Elisa begins visiting the creature in secret?
Are they able to communicate?
They develop a close bond, and she falls in love with the creature
Do they end up together in the end?
Yes they do

Is it pretty heavy/dramatic or lighter in general
?
it's been said to have a lot of tenderness, and it is the powerful vision of a creative master feeling totally, joyously free
Sounds coo, I'd be interested in seeing it. Thanks for talking today!
My pleasure.

uid1response.feedback: They user responded quickly, and the movie sounds interesting enough to see.

uid2response.feedback: Went very well, the film is fantastic.
